channel.title: So I recently purchased my first VPS
channel.description:
And I have absolutely no idea how to use it! I can connect to it fine with an SSH client (Putty) but after that, I have no idea what to do!
If any of you have any experience with a VPS, can you please lend a helping hand?

item.title: So I recently purchased my first VPS
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:22, topic:403639”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=500704.msg3663279#msg3663279 date=1310473981]
If you take a guess on what OS people are running, guessing Windows will most often be the right answer. Just like you assume most people aren’t gay.
[/quote]
Most people use linux for servers. I’d be so fucking lost trying to use a windows server.

I just realized that centos is annoying because it has like 5 packages and you have to compile everything else. So I switched to Ubuntu.

Decent switch, though plain old debian would’ve been fine.
I’m assuming you want to start with a webserver:

sudo apt-get install apache2 php5 libapache2-mod-php5 webmin mysql-server mysql-client php5-mysql phpmyadmin sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get upgrade
Follow this for the basic phpmyadmin / apache setup: http://www.howtoforge.com/ubuntu_debian_lamp_server
Follow this if you have repo issues for webmin (and look at docs to learn to use it): http://www.webmin.com/deb.html

Pretty simple considering you’re installing like a dozen services all working together.

EDIT: FYI, webmin doesn’t need a web server (like apache) even though it’s a web UI.[/quote]
I love you.

item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:403639”]It’s pretty standard, and google does help, but you probably need to do it in steps:

http://www.google.com/search?q=install+smf+on+centos

Again, you didn’t say what forum software you used, but it probably requires PHP5 and MySQL5, and a web server.

Apache is common for a web server, I personally use lighttpd, and also nginx is good. For the other two, you just need php5 and mysql5, you will install all of these through your package manager. (is it yum? not sure on centos)

Ok, a quick google shows yum is what you use, so ssh in and do something like this:

yum install php mysql-server mysql

And you will want some web server too, google for that.

edit:
http://library.linode.com/lamp-guides/centos-5[/quote]
